solution_line_template: The area of the whole front yard is {yard_width} feet by {yard_length} feet, or {yard_width} ft * {yard_length} ft = <<{yard_width}*{yard_length}={yard_area}>>{yard_area} sq.ft.
The sidewalk is {sidewalk_width} feet by {sidewalk_length} feet, or {sidewalk_width}ft * {sidewalk_length}ft = <<{sidewalk_width}*{sidewalk_length}={sidewalk_area}>>{sidewalk_area} sq.ft.

Each of the flower beds right in front of the house is {flower_bed_front_depth} feet by {flower_bed_front_length} feet, or {flower_bed_front_depth} ft * {flower_bed_front_length} ft = {single_front_flower_bed_area} sq.ft. There are {num_front_flower_beds}, so that's {num_front_flower_beds} * {single_front_flower_bed_area} sq.ft. = {total_front_flower_beds_area} sq.ft.

The third flower bed is {flower_bed_third_width} feet by {flower_bed_third_length} feet, or {flower_bed_third_width}ft * {flower_bed_third_length}ft = <<{flower_bed_third_width}*{flower_bed_third_length}={flower_bed_third_area}>>{flower_bed_third_area} sq.ft.

The fourth flower bed is {flower_bed_fourth_width} feet by {flower_bed_fourth_length} feet, or {flower_bed_fourth_width}ft * {flower_bed_fourth_length}ft = <<{flower_bed_fourth_width}*{flower_bed_fourth_length}={flower_bed_fourth_area}>>{flower_bed_fourth_area} sq.ft.

The total area of the sidewalk and flower beds is {sidewalk_area} sq.ft + {total_front_flower_beds_area} sq.ft + {flower_bed_third_area} sq.ft + {flower_bed_fourth_area} sq.ft = <<{sidewalk_area}+{total_front_flower_beds_area}+{flower_bed_third_area}+{flower_bed_fourth_area}={total_excluded_area}>>{total_excluded_area} sq. ft.
So Jill will need a total of {yard_area} sq.ft - {total_excluded_area} sq.ft = <<{yard_area}-{total_excluded_area}={sod_needed}>>{sod_needed} sq.ft. of sod.
